definition: to defeat decisively/to win decisively/great victory/triumph
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)

sentences.english: It was important to get a good result before the Celtic tie.
sentences.chinese: 在对阵凯子的欧冠比赛前，获得一场大胜是如此重要。

sentences.english: This is a great success in the front of politics and ideology of our party and our country.
sentences.chinese: 这是我们党和国家在思想政治战线上的一个伟大胜利。

sentences.english: In math and engineering, recursion, especially, is a big win.
sentences.chinese: 在数学和工程中，递归获得了重大胜利。

sentences.english: He foresaw the German trouncing of Australia on June 13.
sentences.chinese: 他预测了6月13号德国大胜澳大利亚队。

sentences.english: The monkey was above back to sale gun of DingDaSheng threat.
sentences.chinese: 猴子便以上回售枪之事威胁丁大胜。

sentences.english: It was a great victory by our Party and nation in the ideological and political front.
sentences.chinese: 这是我们党和国家在思想政治战线上的一个伟大胜利。

sentences.english: He drubbed his opponent in the table tennis match.
sentences.chinese: 他在乒乓球比赛中大胜对手。

sentences.english: Then a hand push the door and enter, DingDaSheng to explain some of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 这时一手下推门而入，向丁大胜说明了一些情况。

sentences.english: It was a major victory for the embattled software maker.
sentences.chinese: 这对陷入垄断案的微软公司来说是一个重大胜利。

sentences.english: United's Reserves provided a fitting send-off for departing manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, hammering Newcastle United at Moss Lane.
sentences.chinese: 曼联预备队用主场大胜纽卡来为主帅索尔斯克亚送行。

sentences.english: However, his Anfield bow brought a first strike for the Reds in a 3-0 demolition of West Brom.
sentences.chinese: 不管怎样，他在3比0大胜西布朗的比赛中首开纪录。

sentences.english: Mr. Xie is now Director of Finance development dept. of Mitsubishi Corp. China.
sentences.chinese: 谢大胜先生现任三菱商事中国财务开发部部长。

sentences.english: He spoke of his admiration for the Chinese people and the "great sweep of history.
sentences.chinese: 他表达了他对中国人民和“对历史伟大胜利”的敬佩。

sentences.english: On the one hand, it marks a big victory for them.
sentences.chinese: 一方面，它标志着环保主义者取得了重大胜利。

sentences.english: There have hardly been any complete thrashings in this World Cup.
sentences.chinese: 在本届世界杯几乎没有大胜或者轻松击败对手的比赛。

sentences.english: But you cannot win with a mandate if you do not bring the sides together.
sentences.chinese: 但是，如果我们不把各方团结起来，就不可能大胜。

definition: to beat easily/to gain an easy victory
to win by a narrow margin/to barely win/narrow victory
to score a victory/to prevail over one's opponents
total victory/to excel by far/name of a tank/slam
poised for battle/to square up for a fight
an upset (esp. in sports)/unexpected turn of events/to pull off a coup/a breakthrough
